security_audit.summary: The slack-gif-creator is a legitimate creative toolkit with no security risks. It performs exactly its stated function of creating GIF animations with no network access, no code execution vulnerabilities, and no malicious functionality.

content.user_title: Create custom animated GIFs for Slack messages and emoji
content.value_statement: Slack has strict size limits for GIFs (64KB for emoji, 2MB for messages). This toolkit creates optimized animations that meet these constraints while providing professional animation effects.
actual_capabilities: Creates GIFs optimized for Slack's 64KB emoji and 2MB message limits
Provides 15+ animation primitives (bounce, spin, pulse, explode, etc.)
Includes professional easing functions and physics-based effects
Validates GIFs against Slack size and dimension constraints
Supports text rendering with outlines for readability
limitations: Requires Python with PIL, imageio, and numpy dependencies
Emoji GIFs limited to 64KB with strict size constraints
Cannot create GIFs from video files or existing images
Font rendering may vary across different operating systems

best_practices: Always validate GIF size after creation, especially for emoji (64KB limit is strict)
Use fewer frames and solid colors for emoji GIFs - avoid gradients to reduce file size
Add text outlines for readability on small GIFs and different backgrounds
anti_patterns: Don't use more than 15 frames for emoji GIFs - exceeds size limits
Avoid complex gradients in emoji animations - they increase file size significantly
Never skip size validation - upload failures waste time and frustrate users

faq.question: Why do my emoji GIFs fail to upload to Slack?
faq.answer: Slack enforces a strict 64KB limit for emoji. Use the validators to check size before uploading and reduce frames/colors if needed.

faq.question: Can I use existing images or videos to make GIFs?
faq.answer: This toolkit creates animations programmatically. It doesn't convert existing media files but generates new animations from code.

faq.question: How do I ensure my GIFs look good on all devices?
faq.answer: Use the professional color palettes provided and add text outlines for readability across different Slack themes.

faq.question: Is this safe to use on company computers?
faq.answer: Yes, the toolkit only creates image files locally with no network access or external dependencies beyond standard Python libraries.

faq.question: My GIF is over the size limit. How do I fix it?
faq.answer: Reduce frame count, lower color depth, simplify animations, or decrease dimensions. The toolkit provides optimization suggestions.

faq.question: How does this compare to online GIF makers?
faq.answer: This toolkit gives precise control over Slack's specific requirements and creates optimized files that meet their exact constraints.
